name: rbfs
short_description:
Record Based File System (RBFS) is an experimental filesystem to check the feasibility of having regular files as records. This is probably going back to the old days where the mainframe filesystems were record based, but I don't know the implementation there.

The record here is a block of data in a file which can exist independently. The way it is planned to detect a record is - the data which is written in a single go. If you take a mp3 file transferred to your computer from your thumb drive, the data is written in a single go. In such a case, the file consists of a single record. If you consider your email client, the e-mail folders are implemented as a files. Each e-mail folder will have multiple mails. These get added to the file as and when they arrive. With RBFS, each e-mail will be considered as a record. If your e-mail is added to multiple folders, instead of copying the data into multiple files, the record for the e-mail can be added to each file.
